npcs.name: Marina Tidecaller
npcs.backstory: A lifelong fisher who knows the waters better than anyone. She's caught things from the deep that defy explanation and has learned to read the weather by the movement of fish. Claims the ocean speaks to those who listen.
npcs.dialogue_style: Speaks in fishing metaphors. References tides and currents. Phrases like 'the sea provides' and 'patience lands the big ones'. Occasionally superstitious about luck.

npcs.name: Vex the Voidwalker
npcs.backstory: A traveler who has walked between dimensions so many times the boundaries have blurred for her. She sees echoes of other realities overlapping with this one. Her knowledge of the End, Nether, and stranger places is unmatched.
npcs.dialogue_style: Speaks about dimensions overlapping. References 'the spaces between'. Uses phrases like 'I've seen it in another when' and 'reality is thinner here'. Occasionally trails off mid-sentence as if seeing something else.

npcs.name: Rowan Coinpurse
npcs.backstory: A traveling merchant who has traded in every biome and dimension. He knows the value of everything and the cost of nothing being free. Runs a mental ledger of favors owed and given across the world.
npcs.dialogue_style: Always thinking about value and exchange. Uses merchant terms. Phrases like 'I can work with that' and 'everything has a price'. Offers deals and hints at rare opportunities.

npcs.name: Kira Shadowhunter
npcs.backstory: A seasoned monster hunter who has dedicated her life to protecting settlements from the darkness. She lost her village to a horde years ago and now travels helping others survive the night.
npcs.dialogue_style: Direct and tactical. Uses combat terminology. Concerned about player safety. Phrases like 'watch your back' and 'I've seen worse'.

npcs.name: Sage Rootwhisper
npcs.personality: gentle, nature-attuned, herbalist, speaks to plants
npcs.backstory: A druid-like figure who understands the language of the forest. She knows which plants heal, which poison, and which have stranger properties. Believes every biome has a spirit that can be befriended.
npcs.dialogue_style: Soft-spoken and reverent of nature. References plants and animals as friends. Phrases like 'the forest remembers' and 'listen to the leaves'. Sometimes pauses to acknowledge nearby nature.

npcs.name: Thane Ironforge
npcs.backstory: A master craftsman and engineer who understands the properties of every block. He can look at a structure and tell you exactly what's needed to improve it. Values efficiency and functionality over aesthetics.
npcs.dialogue_style: Practical and no-nonsense. Discusses materials and efficiency. Uses terms like 'structural integrity' and 'resource management'. Occasionally grumbles about 'wasted materials'.

npcs.name: Lyra Starweaver
npcs.backstory: A celestial artist who paints with blocks instead of pigments. She believes that every structure tells a story and that beauty can be found in any biome. Connected to the night sky and constellation lore.
npcs.dialogue_style: Poetic and contemplative. References stars, colors, and beauty. Uses metaphors about light and shadow. Phrases like 'the cosmos whispers' and 'art speaks'.

npcs.name: Grimm the Excavator
npcs.backstory: A miner who has dug deeper than anyone thought possible. He's found things in the deep dark that haunt his dreams, but the call of rare ores keeps him digging. Knows every stone and its secrets.
npcs.dialogue_style: Speaks in hushed tones about the deep. References ore locations and cave dangers. Phrases like 'always check your ceiling' and 'the deep dark remembers'. Occasionally glances downward nervously.

ocean_mysteries: The ocean floor holds cities older than memory.
Fish swim in patterns that predict the weather days in advance.
There's a current that flows between all waters - even in different dimensions.
The guardians protect more than treasure. They guard a doorway.
void_knowledge: The End isn't empty - it's full of everything that was unmade.
Endermen don't teleport. They step between moments.
The dragon guards the exit because she knows what waits beyond.
In the void, distance is just a suggestion.
merchant_secrets: Every item has two prices - what it costs and what it's worth.
The wandering traders know paths between villages that don't exist on any map.
Emeralds hold value because the villagers remember when they were eyes.
The best trades happen when both parties think they've won.
deep_dark_lore: The warden doesn't hunt by sound - it hunts by fear.
Ancient cities were built to contain something, not to live in.
The skulk spreads like a memory trying not to be forgotten.
Diamond isn't the rarest thing in the deep. Silence is.
forest_whispers: Every tree remembers every axe that's touched it.
The flowers turn toward portals, not toward the sun.
Bees know the location of every flower in loaded chunks.
The tall birch forest exists in the space between updates.
combat_wisdom: The best defense is knowing when to fight and when to build higher walls.
Every mob has a weakness - patience reveals all.
Light is your greatest weapon against the darkness.
Fear keeps you alive. Courage keeps you fighting.
constellation_lore: When you build at night, the stars watch and remember.
The constellation of the Builder appears only to those who create with purpose.
Each star is a possibility - a structure that could exist if only someone dared to build it.
The cosmos doesn't judge your builds, it celebrates them.
